channel.title: Matrix Login Issue?
channel.description: Hey, for some reason, some people are unable to stay logged in on the server. When they run the client it loads, but when they login, it takes a long time to load, then the moment you can see the game interface it disconnects you. Anyone know what is wrong here? It doesn't do it to everyone, only some aren't able to.

item.title: Matrix Login Issue?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

I let them try doing that, higher runtime parameter and latest jdk installed, no dice.

Read full topic

item.title: Matrix Login Issue?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Make sure they have JDK1.7.0_03 before fucking with the mem usage.

Read full topic

item.title: Matrix Login Issue?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

So it’s just because their memory is too low? As a host I’m sure I’m able to handle it. Would it work if they higher the memory they put into the client? And how can I lower the memory usage?

Read full topic

item.title: Matrix Login Issue?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:3, topic:437604”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=540309.msg3956812#msg3956812 date=1332827670]
It’s because they don’t have jdk1.7, or they have a horribly bad graphics card.
[/quote]
if they didnt have the version it was compiled with it wouldn’t run at all.

My guess is either your host cant handle it, and they get timed out, or they need more RAM.[/quote]

Ahh I see, my computer doesn’t let me log into high mem use 704’s. Ahrims and Matrix aren’t too bad because they’ve actually shortened some code and fucked about a bit, whereas everyone else has just leached it.

Read full topic

item.title: Matrix Login Issue?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Ruby Forums Coder:

It’s because they don’t have jdk1.7, or they have a horribly bad graphics card.

if they didnt have the version it was compiled with it wouldn’t run at all.

My guess is either your host cant handle it, and they get timed out, or they need more RAM.

Read full topic
